title: Dotted Typeface
content: Wondering if anyone knows what the dotted typeface is. I've looked at myfonts.com, fontshop, veer and a few other places and can't find a match. The design firm is in the UK, so maybe it's available only in Europe? Thanks for any help... ![Dotted Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231175917im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49346.jpg)
author: anonymous

comments.content:
\>\>   
If it suits you, you could make a font like this in   
about half an hour.   
In a vector app, just make a 5X7 dot grid,   
duplicate it 36 times, and remove dots   
to make letters and numbers.   
\>\>   
Not quite true -- note the intermediate position in the slant of the R. Somebody gave this more thought than the average pixelpusher does.   
The grid uses a lot more positions than 35!

true dat, Bert. good eye.   
   
and don't limit yourself to a circle.   
You can do this with any shape,   
with varying results.

There's also [Fireflylove Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231175917/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/testpilot/fireflylove/bold/testdrive.html?s=NSRL%2F2003&p=60) from Test Pilot Collective ... similar again.

Pieter Van Rosmalen's [Dotted Weekend](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231175917/http:/fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=GF.107112.0.3&charSize=14&sampleText=NSRL203&sampleSize=60) could be customized to match.
Thanks for the ideas. So many of these are close but not exact, maybe it is a custom face. BJ, thanks for the idea, I might just give that a try...

Ignacio, this seems to be the closest match. This really is good work - especially for one of these shareware/freeware fonts. I try to stay away from these since so often they aren't worth the download.

it's not a match, but Kirmes   
is an E+F dotfont with a little   
bit more personality.   
   
 [http://www.elsner-flake.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231175917/http:/www.elsner-flake.com/)   
   
If it suits you, you could make a font like this in   
about half an hour.   
In a vector app, just make a 5X7 dot grid,   
duplicate it 36 times, and remove dots   
to make letters and numbers.   
   
bj
